awd_titl_txt: Open Mirror Symmetry for Toric Varieties
awd_abstract_narration:
Mirror symmetry as a duality from string physics builds a bridge between seemingly very different mathematical theories on one manifold and its mirror manifold. Open mirror symmetry is this duality in the open string sector, which involves mathematical theories especially associated to open strings. This project studies open mirror symmetry from both enumerative and categorical aspects. In the enumerative aspect, the PI proposes to investigate and prove the enumerative prediction (remodeling conjecture) from mirror symmetry for toric Calabi-Yaus in a multi-step project, including the cases of toric orbifolds. The remodeling conjecture uses a recursive relation to predict higher genus topological string amplitudes. When applied to orbifolds, this conjecture predicts Gromov-Witten potential currently unknown by other methods, such as topological vertex. As for the categorical aspect, this project continues the PI and collaborators' previous work on Kontsevich's homological mirror symmetry (HMS), especially around T-duality and coherent-constructible correspondence (CCC) that PI et. al. construct. In particular, the PI plans to construct a geometric T-duality procedure for arbitrary vector bundles on toric varieties and toric normal crossings, and prove this procedure is consistent with the CCC, which is combinatorial in nature. In the interplay of these two aspects, the calculation of disk invariants is an essential ingredient in explicitly studying HMS with obstructed Lagragians, such as HMS for toric Calabi-Yau threefolds, which this project also plans to address.

String theory is a candidate physics theory to describe all known fundamental forces. It requires sophisticated mathematics, and vice-versa, string theory has a long-lasting and deep influence on modern mathematics. There are several seemingly different set-ups of string theories ? if string theory wants to be the theory of this universe, there cannot be several different theories ? fortunately furthermore there are string dualities relating them. It turns out that these different set-ups are equivalent, and there is essentially a single string theory. Mirror symmetry is one of these dualities that equates two types of set-ups (IIA and IIB). In mathematics, this translates into beautiful and unforeseen connections between two vastly distinct areas of geometry. This project studies several mathematical aspects of mirror symmetry among toric varieties, a kind of spaces that serve as a simplified model of the extra-dimension in string physics. It contributes to the basic understanding of relevant mathematics, such as algebraic geometry, and also provides a concrete approach to a more complicated string theory from an equivalent-but-easier way.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE TRUSTEES OF COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY IN THE CITY OF NEW YORK

por.por_cntn:
Using dualities, string theoriests have been making predictions on enumerative invariants which count geometric objects. One of the best known dualities is mirror symmetry relating the A-model on a Calabi-Yau threefold to the B-model on its mirror Calabi-Yau threefold. Gromov-Witten theory (resp. open Gromov-Witten theory) can be viewed as a mathematical theory of the A-model topological closed strings (resp. A-model topological open strings).  Gromov-Witten (GW) invariants count parametrized holomorphic curves, while open GW invariants count parametrized holomorphic curves with Lagrangian boundary conditions. 

Using mirror symmetry, Aganagic-Vafa and Aganagic-Klemm-Vafa related genus zero open GW invariants, which are virtual counts of holomorphic disks in a symplectic toric Calabi-Yau 3-fold X bounded by a class of Lagrangian submanifolds known as Aganagic-Vafa A-branes, to the classical Abel-Jacobi map of the mirror curve of X, which are expressible in terms of explicit hypergeometric series.  This conjecture was proved in full generality by Bohan Fang (the former PI) and Melissa Liu (the current PI) in 2011. The first outcome of this project is an orbifold version of this genus zero open mirror theorem (Fang-Liu-Tseng). The main goal of the project is to prove the Remodeling Conjecture proposed by Bouchard-Klemm-Marino-Pasquetti (BKMP) relating open and closed GW invariants of a symplectic toric Calabi-Yau 3-manifold/3-orbifold X to Eynard-Orantin invariants of the mirror curve of X.  The BKMP Remodeling Conjecture can be viewed as an all genus open-closed mirror symmetry.  Eynard-Orantin provided a proof of the Remodeling Conjecture in the manifold case in 2012. With Zong, the former and current PIs proved the orbifold version of the Remodeling Conjecture, first for any affine toric Calabi-Yau 3-orbifolds, and eventually for general symplectic toric Calabi-Yau 3-orbifolds. Indeed, we prove a generalized version of the original conjecture: in the original conjecture by BKMP, the Lagrangian is always on an effective leg (so that it does not contain any orbifold point); our results cover both effective and gerby legs (the Lagrangian may contain a stacky circle). 

The project has trained both graduate and undergraduate students. During the period of the award, the PI has supervised a PhD thesis on orbifold GW theory, a PhD thesis on orbifold Donaldson-Thomas theory, and a senior thesis on orbifold quantum cohomology. The award has provided funding for participation of conferences, visits for collaboration, and undergraduate research.


Last Modified: 10/08/2017
Modified by: Melissa Liu
